com.bigdata.rdf.graph.impl.util

Class ManagedIntArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.graph.impl.util.ManagedIntArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IIntArraySlice, IManagedIntArray

    public class ManagedIntArray
extends Object
implements IManagedIntArray
    A view on a mutable int[] that may be extended.

    Note: The backing int[] always has an offset of ZERO (0) and a length equal to the capacity of the backing int[].

    This class is NOT thread-safe for mutation. The operation which replaces the array() when the capacity of the backing buffer must be extended is not atomic.

    Version:
    $Id: ByteArrayBuffer.java 6279 2012-04-12 15:27:30Z thompsonbry $ TODO Refactor to create a test suite for this.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagedIntArray

        public ManagedIntArray()
        Creates a buffer with an initial capacity of 128 bytes. The capacity of the buffer will be automatically extended as required.

      • ManagedIntArray

        public ManagedIntArray(int initialCapacity)
        Creates a buffer with the specified initial capacity. The capacity of the buffer will be automatically extended as required.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - The initial capacity.

      • ManagedIntArray

        public ManagedIntArray(int[] array)
        Create a view wrapping the entire array.

        Note: the caller's reference will be used until and unless the array is grown, at which point the caller's reference will be replaced by a larger array having the same data.

        Parameters:
        array - The array.

    • Method Detail

      • array

        public final int[] array()
        The backing array. This method DOES NOT guarantee that the backing array reference will remain constant. Some implementations use an extensible backing array and will replace the reference when the backing buffer is extended. This is re-allocated whenever the capacity of the buffer is too small and reused otherwise.
        Specified by:
        array in interface IIntArraySlice

      • off

        public final int off()
        The start of the slice in the IIntArraySlice.array().

        The offset of the slice into the backing byte[] is always zero.

        Specified by:
        off in interface IIntArraySlice

      • len

        public final int len()
        The length of the slice in the IIntArraySlice.array().

        The length of the slice is always the capacity of the backing byte[].

        Specified by:
        len in interface IIntArraySlice

      • slice

        public IIntArraySlice slice(int off,
                            int len)
        Description copied from interface: IIntArraySlice
        Return a slice of the backing buffer. The slice will always reference the current backing IIntArraySlice.array(), even when the buffer is extended and the array reference is replaced.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
